data.title: As calls to break up big tech grow louder, a split may pay off for one tech company
data.text: With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Pete Najarian, Mark Tepper, Karen Finerman, and Dan Nathan.

data.title: U.S. antitrust chief says past enforcement could presage new probe of current digital giants
data.text: The top U.S. antitrust enforcer said on Tuesday that studying enforcement actions against Standard Oil and AT&T decades ago can help lay the groundwork for looking at possible anti-competitive behavior at today's tech giants such as Alphabet's Google and Facebook.

data.title: Apple Doesn't Need to Make All iPhones for U.S. in China
data.text: Jun.11 -- Foxconn makes most of the smartphones on the Chinese mainland now.

data.title: 5 Tech Stocks That Are Far Too Risky Right Now
data.text: Many tech stocks are still facing significant headwinds, and these five companies are among the most worrisome.

data.title: Apple joins the open-source Cloud Native Computing Foundation
data.text: The Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), the home of open-source projects like Kubernetes, today announced that Apple is joining it as a top-level Platinum End User Member. With this, Apple is joining 89 existing CNCF end-user members like Adidas, Atlassian, Box, GitHub, the New York Times, Reddit, Spotify and Walmart.

data.title: Goldman CEO says he's testing the bank's credit card with Apple and consumers are going to love it
data.text: Solomon is personally testing the iPhone-lined credit card, which is set to be released this summer, Solomon said in an interview with Carl Quintanilla.

data.title: Why Tech Stocks Rising at Fastest Pace in 7 Years May Flame Out
data.text: Antitrust probes and slowing earnings growth are among the headwinds facing the sector.

data.title: Tuesday Apple Rumors: Apple Pencil May Get Floating Gesture Controls
data.text: Tuesday's Apple Rumors include how the company ranks in a brand value list, avoiding the trade way between the U.S. and China, and more.

data.title: Analysts Discuss Broadcom's New Supply Agreement With Apple
data.text: Broadcom Inc (NASDAQ: AVGO) confirmed Monday in a regulatory filing a new two-year agreement to supply Apple Inc.

data.title: Apple Could Build iPhones Outside Of China If Needed, Supplier Says
data.text: Apple has a backup plan if the U.S.-China trade war gets out of hand.

data.title: Apple Stock Is Caught Between Two Eras
data.text:
Once you buy an Apple Watch to monitor one chronic condition, you are part of the Apple ecosystem and ready to buy more.

data.title: Ann Winblad: Tech companies are asking the government to help regulate content
data.text: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill are gearing up to begin hearings to explore the dominance of big tech.

data.title: Lawmakers begin antitrust investigations into big tech companies
data.text: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill are starting their investigative hearings into the dominance of big tech.

data.title: My Top Stock to Buy in June
data.text: Trading at just 15 times its free cash flow and eight times its net cash, this tech giant is buy-worthy.

data.title: Foxconn has enough capacity outside China to meet Apple's U.S. demand
data.text: Foxconn, the world's top contract electronics assembler, said it had enough capacity outside China to meet Apple's demand in the American market if the need should arise for the iPhone maker to adjust its production lines due to the U.S.-China trade war.

data.title: Revolut adds Apple Pay support in 16 markets
data.text: Fintech startup Revolut has expanded its support for Apple Pay, confirming that from today the payment option is available for users in 16 European markets. The list of supported markets is: UK, France, Poland, Germany, Czech Republic, Spain, Italy, Switzerland, Ireland, Belgium, Austria, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland and Iceland.

data.title: Shazam for Android now recognizes music played through headphones
data.text: Shazam, the Apple-owned app that helps users identify songs playing around them, can now recognize songs you’re listening to through your headphones when using an Android phone or tablet.
